title: Suya Swordfish
summary: Suya Swordfish is a gluten free and dairy free recipe with 2 servings. One serving contains 966 calories, 55g of protein, and 82g of fat. For $5.1 per serving, this recipe covers 33% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. Head to the store and pick up chili pepper, ground ginger, roasted peanuts, and a few other things to make it today. To use up the peanut butter you could follow this main course with the Peanut Butter Oatmeal Chocolate Chip Cookies as a dessert. A few people made this recipe, and 37 would say it hit the spot. It works best as a main course, and is done in about 45 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 92%. This score is amazing. Similar recipes include Chicken Suya, Suya (Nigerian Chicken Skewers), and Swordfish Skewers.
instructions: Make the peanut paste by combining peanut butter, paprika, chili pepper, salt, ground ginger and lime juice.                                  Stir well and taste. Adjust spices as necessary                                  Place fish strips in a large bowl  and pour peanut sauce over it, then using your hands, mix well ensuring the pieces are coated with the sauce.                                  Leave to marinate for a few hours or overnight.                                  When ready to cook, prepare the bbq and let the coals heat up till fiery red.                                  Then pass (soaked wooden) skewers through each piece of swordfish, and place on an oiled rack. Let cook for 5-6 minutes on one side, then flip over and let the other side cook for 2-3 minutes. If not ready, remove to part of grill where heat is indirect and let cook till ready.                                  Serve with thinly sliced red onions, sliced cherry tomatoes, lime halves and coriander leaves                                  In a blender or food processor, grind the peanuts till they are crushed.The ground nuts will stick to the sides of the mixing container, so using a spatula, loosen bits from the bottom and round the sides.                                  Then add oil, drizzling in along with a pinch of salt, blending till you get a 'thick cream' consistency.                                  Use as directed above.

steps.step: Make the peanut paste by combining peanut butter, paprika, chili pepper, salt, ground ginger and lime juice.
Stir well and taste. Adjust spices as necessary
Place fish strips in a large bowl  and pour peanut sauce over it, then using your hands, mix well ensuring the pieces are coated with the sauce.
Leave to marinate for a few hours or overnight.
When ready to cook, prepare the bbq and let the coals heat up till fiery red.
Then pass (soaked wooden) skewers through each piece of swordfish, and place on an oiled rack.
Let cook for 5-6 minutes on one side, then flip over and let the other side cook for 2-3 minutes. If not ready, remove to part of grill where heat is indirect and let cook till ready.
Serve with thinly sliced red onions, sliced cherry tomatoes, lime halves and coriander leaves

In a blender or food processor, grind the peanuts till they are crushed.The ground nuts will stick to the sides of the mixing container, so using a spatula, loosen bits from the bottom and round the sides.
Then add oil, drizzling in along with a pinch of salt, blending till you get a 'thick cream' consistency.
